headline.print_headline: Venezuela: American Citizen Detained, Chávez Says
headline.main: Venezuela: American Citizen Detained, Chávez Says

docs.snippet: President Hugo Chávez, who voiced his suspicions that the man could be a “mercenary” plotting to destabilize the country, did not identify the man or detail the accusations against him....
docs.abstract: Venezuelan Pres Hugo Chavez says authorities have detained an American citizen and are interrogating him, voicing suspicions that the man could be a mercenary plotting to destabilize the country; does not identify the man or detail the accusations against him.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Hugo Chávez, who voiced his suspicions that the man could be a “mercenary” plotting to destabilize the country, did not identify the man or detail the accusations against him.

headline.print_headline: Report Looks At Hospital In Outbreak Of Hepatitis
headline.seo: Report Cites New Hampshire Hospital in Hepatitis C Outbreak
headline.main: Report Looks at Hospital in Outbreak of Hepatitis

docs.snippet: Thousands of patients in New Hampshire are being tested after a medical technician, who had worked in eight states since 2007, is linked to syringes left unattended on carts....
docs.abstract: Thousands of patients in New Hampshire are being tested for hepatitis C in the wake of an outbreak linked to medical technician David Kwiatowski.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of patients in New Hampshire are being tested after a medical technician, who had worked in eight states since 2007, is linked to syringes left unattended on carts.

headline.print_headline: Japan: Inspectors Study Plant That Avoided Disaster
headline.main: Japan: Inspectors Study Plant That Avoided Disaster

docs.snippet: The Onagawa plant was closest to the epicenter of last year’s earthquake but was largely undamaged because it was designed with enough safety margins, nuclear inspectors said Friday....
docs.abstract: Japanese nuclear inspectors say the Onagawa power plant was closest to the epicenter of the 2011 earthquake and endured more ground-shaking than the Fukushima plant, but was largely undamaged because it was designed with enough safety margins.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Onagawa plant was closest to the epicenter of last year’s earthquake but was largely undamaged because it was designed with enough safety margins, nuclear inspectors said Friday.

headline.print_headline: Lakers Again Land Large Piece of Puzzle
headline.seo: Dwight Howard Trade Gives Lakers Large Piece of Puzzle
headline.main: Lakers Again Land a Large Piece of the Puzzle

docs.snippet: Los Angeles acquired the best big man of the era — for the second time since signing Shaquille O’Neal in 1996 — and with Steve Nash, can also claim the N.B.A.’s top starting backcourt....
docs.abstract: Howard Beck On Pro Basketball column on Los Angeles Lakers acquiring premier center Dwight Howard, who he calls the best big man of the era.

byline.contributor: Greg Bishop contributed reporting from London.

docs.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles acquired the best big man of the era — for the second time since signing Shaquille O’Neal in 1996 — and with Steve Nash, can also claim the N.B.A.’s top starting backcourt.

headline.print_headline: Equity Funds Shrink as Investors Move To Bonds
headline.main: Equity Funds Shrink as Investors Move To Bonds

docs.snippet: Investors pulled cash out of stock mutual funds for the fifth consecutive month in July, while bond funds again attracted new cash, new statistics showed Friday....
docs.abstract: Statistics show that investors pulled cash out of stock mutual funds for the fifth consecutive month in July, while bond funds once again attracted new cash.
docs.lead_paragraph: Investors pulled cash out of stock mutual funds for the fifth consecutive month in July, while bond funds again attracted new cash, new statistics showed Friday.

headline.print_headline: Data Concern Gains 28% After Strong Quarter
headline.main: Data Concern Gains 28% After Strong Quarter

docs.snippet: Shares of Fusion-io Inc. rose 28 percent on Friday after the company, which makes flash memory products, reported fiscal fourth-quarter results well above Wall Street’s expectations on Thursday....
docs.abstract: Shares of Fusion-io Inc rise 28 percent after the company reports fiscal fourth-quarter results well above Wall Street's expectations; company had a loss of $2.4 million, or 3 cents a share, in the April-June period; revenue rose 49 percent to $106.6 million, from $71.7 million a year earlier.
docs.lead_paragraph: Shares of Fusion-io Inc. rose 28 percent on Friday after the company, which makes flash memory products, reported fiscal fourth-quarter results well above Wall Street’s expectations on Thursday.

headline.seo: Water Damage: More Blacks Lack Swimming Skills

docs.snippet: Why do so few black children know how to swim?...
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Martha Southgate explores why so many African-Americans do not know how to swim; suggests that community centers and public schools in the United States devote more time to teaching children to swim.
docs.lead_paragraph: Why do so few black children know how to swim?

headline.print_headline: Sami Rohr, Jewish Philanthropist Remembered by a Writing Prize, Dies at 86

headline.main: Sami Rohr, Jewish Philanthropist Remembered by a Writing Prize, Dies at 86

docs.snippet: Mr. Rohr, who made a fortune in real estate after fleeing the Nazis, was honored by his children in 2006 with the creation of the Sami Rohr Prize for Jewish Literature....

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Rohr, who made a fortune in real estate after fleeing the Nazis, was honored by his children in 2006 with the creation of the Sami Rohr Prize for Jewish Literature.

headline.print_headline: Tribes Won’t Be Required To Reimburse Government
headline.main: Tribes Won’t Be Required to Reimburse Government

docs.snippet: The Obama administration says Indian tribes do not have to reimburse the government for buying divided tribal land so it can be returned to them....
docs.abstract: Obama administration says Indian tribes do not have to reimburse the government for buying divided tribal land so it can be returned to them as part of $3.4 billion settlement over the Interior Department's mismanagement of Indian land royalties.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says Indian tribes do not have to reimburse the government for buying divided tribal land so it can be returned to them.

headline.print_headline: India: Official’s Advice Prompts an Outcry
headline.main: India: Official’s Advice Prompts an Outcry

docs.snippet: A minister in India’s most populous state, Uttar Pradesh, has said bureaucrats can steal a little as long as they work hard, prompting a national outcry in a country long plagued by corruption scandals....
docs.abstract: Minister in India’s most populous state Uttar Pradesh says bureaucrats can steal a little as long as they work hard, prompting a national outcry in a country long plagued by corruption scandals.
docs.lead_paragraph: A minister in India’s most populous state, Uttar Pradesh, has said bureaucrats can steal a little as long as they work hard, prompting a national outcry in a country long plagued by corruption scandals.
